title: Skype services restored after network glitch hits users globally
text: #Microsoft Skype services restored after network glitch hits users globally Users of Skype around the globe were unable to make calls after a technical problem that made each person appear as if they were offline even if they were online. ETCIO | 22 September 2015, 11:09 AM IST Share Users of Skype around the globe were unable to make calls after a technical problem that made each person appear as if they were offline even if they were online.Skype users were unable to change their status or make calls until an update was released.A post on Skype's heartbeat website that allows users to check at a glance how Skype products are performing, said "we have identified the network issue which prevented users from logging in and using Skype today. We're in the process of reconnecting our users, and focused on restoring full service. The issue did not affect Skype for Business users."Skype said that the services had been fully restored now.Microsoft had acquired Skype for $8.5 billion in 2011. At the end of last year, Skype had more than 300 million users world-wide.
